alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 7:34AM PST until February 25 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Santa Ynez River At Narrows affecting Santa Barbara County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is now expected to begin during the mid to late morning hours today, due to releases from Lake Cachuma. * WHERE...Santa Ynez River At Narrows. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, flooding threatens agricultural land and outlying grounds of federal prison. At 15.0 feet, flooding is a threat to lower Lompoc, especially around Floradale Ave. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM PST this morning, the stage was 13.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.6 feet around 1 pm PST this afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
